Pre-Game Insights: The Indonesian national team must win against Vietnam in the second match of Group D of the 2023 Asian Cup.
The match will be held at the Abdullah bin califah Stadium, Doha, on Friday, January 19, 2024, at 21.30 WIB.
Victory is crucial for both teams to keep their chances of qualifying for the knockout stages.
Both teams have not yet bagged a single point from the inaugural match.
The Garuda squad lost 1-3 to Iraq, while Vietnam was defeated by Japan with a score of 2-4.
Indonesia is ranked fourth and Vietnam is in third place in the Group D standings.
The Garuda Squad under Shin Tae-yong is expected to field a more prepared and compact main squad compared to the first matchday against Iraq.

Football observer Akmal Marhali noted that despite losing 1-3 to Iraq, the Indonesian national team showed an improved performance compared to their previous meeting in the 2026 World Cup Qualification in the Asian Zone.
Akmal Marhali highlighted that communication between lines and final settlement need improvement for Indonesia to achieve the three-point target.
The Indonesian national team has the motivation to improve their record against Vietnam, having not won in the last six matches against the Golden Star.
